pullRequest.title: TRUNK-5181: State password rules on installation wizard page
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description of what I changed


State password rules on installation wizard page
Screenshot:

Issue I worked on




see https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/TRUNK-5181
Checklist: I completed these to help reviewers :)




 My pull request only contains ONE single commit
(the number above, next to the 'Commits' tab is 1).
No? -> read here on how to squash multiple commits into one


 My IDE is configured to follow the code style of this project.
No? Unsure? -> configure your IDE, format the code and add the changes with git add . && git commit --amend


 I have added tests to cover my changes. (If you refactored
existing code that was well tested you do not have to add tests)
No? -> write tests and add them to this commit git add . && git commit --amend


 I ran mvn clean package right before creating this pull request and
added all formatting changes to my commit.
No? -> execute above command


 All new and existing tests passed.
No? -> figure out why and add the fix to your commit. It is your responsibility to make sure your code works.


 My pull request is based on the latest changes of the master branch.
No? Unsure? -> execute command git pull --rebase upstream master

nodes.bodyText: Can you do proper formatting of different tags so that they can be easily viewed? On a glimpse they appear to be jumbled.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,7 +21,16 @@ $l10n.get("install.advanced.admin.password.retype"): - + + + $l10n.get("install.advanced.admin.password.constraints") :
+ $l10n.get("install.advanced.admin.password.constraints.min.length")
+ $l10n.get("install.advanced.admin.password.constraints.cases")
+ $l10n.get("install.advanced.admin.password.constraints.numbers")
+ $l10n.get("install.advanced.admin.password.constraints.username")
+ + +

nodes.bodyText: Contains numbers appears to be a vague statement. Shouldn't it be like "Contains at least one number".?
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -2944,6 +2944,11 @@ install.advanced.other.update=Do you want updates to the database to be automati install.advanced.admin=Step 4 of 5 install.advanced.admin.password.info=Currently the default administrator user/pass is admin:test. Please specify a new password for that user install.advanced.admin.password.retype=Retype password +install.advanced.admin.password.constraints=Your Password should follow the following constraints +install.advanced.admin.password.constraints.min.length=Contains minimum 8 characters +install.advanced.admin.password.constraints.cases=Contains both upper and lowercase letters +install.advanced.admin.password.constraints.numbers=Contains numbers
